required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of Visual Range of Motion Estimates
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Visual Range of Motion Estimates Among Physical Therapists and Physical Therapy Students

brief_summary.textblock: Examine the accuracy of visual estimates of various joint angles by physical therapists at various levels of education and clinical practice, taking into account years of experience, areas of practices and specialty certifications.

detailed_description.textblock: Physical therapists oftentimes will estimate rather than measure joint range of motion. The accuracy of visual estimates of various joint measurements has not been previously assessed. No comparison has been done for years of experience and accuracy of estimations. This study will create a survey with pictures of joints at previously measured angles and therapists and students will be asked to estimate the range of motion. Various statistical analyses will be performed to determine accuracy and comparisons.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of estimated ROM to actual ROM
primary_outcome.description: Compare the estimated ROM provided by the student/clinician to the actual measured ROM of the joint of the model.

clinical_study.condition: Accuracy of Estimation of Joint Range of Motion

arm_group.description: students currently enrolled in DPT program

intervention.description: No interventions separated the groups. Each group reviewed pictures and wrote down their estimated ROM of the joint pictured.

study_pop.textblock: adults who are currently enrolled in a DPT program or graduates and licensed physical therapy practioners.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- licensed physical therapists
- students currently enrolled in an accredited doctorate of physical therapy program
Exclusion Criteria:
- students have not been trained in range of motion measurements
- are not licensed physical therapists
